newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: Argentina's Bunge y Born selling chemical stake.
newsitem.headline: Argentina's Bunge y Born selling chemical stake.

text.p: Argentine food and industrial conglomerate Bunge y Born said Monday it accepted an offer to sell its 50.4 percent stake in agrochemical firm Atanor to U.S. firm Albaugh Inc for $58.4 million.
The deal could be finalized in about 15 days, Bunge y Born said in a letter released Monday by the Buenos Aires Stock Exchange.

Molinos Rio de la Plata, Bunge's flag-ship food company, also told the stock exchange Monday that it had accepted an offer to sell Iowa-based Albaugh the 5.7-percent stake it has in Atanor for $6.6 million.
Atanor, which makes weed-killers and chemical products, posted revenues of $170 million in 1995. It exports about 30 percent of its output.
Atanor is the last non-food company Bunge plans to sell as a part of a strategy launched three years ago to concentrate on the food business.

"We plan to keep on making inroads into new food markets in our country putting emphasis on the strategic advantages of the wide business portfolio of Molinos," Bunge y Born's President Salvador Carbo said.
Earlier this month Molinos paid $53 million to buy a local frozen food company from U.S: commodities giant Cargill.
